root.name: POST()
root.description: The POST method is used to submit data to a web server to be processed. This is the method most commonly used by web browsers to send data from forms when the user clicks on a "Submit" button. The params array contains the names of the form fields. The values array must be the same size as and contain the values corresponding, in order, to the names specified in the params array. If you need to submit binary data, create an array of Objects that can contain either String values or byte array (byte[]) objects containing the binary data.
root.syntax: POST(file, params, values); POST(file, params, data);

parameter.label: file
parameter.description: String: name of the web page/script that will process the data

parameter.label: params
parameter.description: String[]: an array of String objects containing the names of form fields being submitted

parameter.label: values
parameter.description: String[]: an array of String objects containing the values of form fields being submitted

parameter.label: data
parameter.description: Object[]: an array of objects, each object either String or byte[], representing values or binary data being submitted
